name: Tina Porou

tweet: Every documentary filmmaker needs to read Decolonizing Methodologies. The history of docs is and still remains colonial, dehumanizing and an adjunct to power.   #BecauseOfLindaTuhiwaiSmith  I believe in the possibilities of documentary again.

tweet: #BecauseOfLindaTuhiwaiSmith I was able to superficially decipher why ‚Äúresearch‚Äù is one of the dirtiest, bloodiest words & position my work as unapologetically anti-colonial. name: Reakeeta Smallwood
tweet: #BecauseOfLindaTuhiwaiSmith I agree, she has taught me so much in my interrogation of my place in the academy and work in my community. Listen up @waikato open your eyes, ears and hearts and stop your gammon

name: Courtney Carothers
tweet: #BecauseOfLindaTuhiwaiSmith so many of us are trying to make visible and eliminate extractive and dehumanizing research processes and center #IndigenousSovereignty is all aspects of social science work.

name: Courtney Carothers
tweet: #BecauseOfLindaTuhiwaiSmith I radically shifted my research practice and teaching. Our methods class reads #DecolonizingMethodologies next week.

name: Dr. Jessica Black
tweet: #BecauseOfLindaTuhiwaiSmith I persisted through my PhD. Her work was my safe space to return to. We must systematically dismantle racism every single day, calling out what is wrong and being brave. I stand in solidarity across oceans with a friend and mentor Linda Tuhiwai Smith‚úäüèæ

name: Sandra Martin Harris
tweet: Embracing the concept of ‚Äúindigenist‚Äù a shared concept with ward Churchill...grounded my MA research, along with Karen Martin‚Äôs aboriginal ontology #ways #whole #strengths #grounded #yintah #people #culture #BecauseOfLindaTuhiwaiSmith

tweet: My conceptions of what student success means for minoritized individuals was broadened beyond capitalist & patriarchal frameworks #BecauseOfLindaTuhiwaiSmith

tweet: Sometimes you have to look hard to find a book in all the stacks. name: jonny bubbles
tweet: #BecauseOfLindaTuhiwaiSmith I went to grad school and *have stayed* in grad school. I frequently return to her book because it told me that my story matters no matter what the white man and racist institutions have to say.

name: Nisha Toomey
tweet: #BecauseOfLindaTuhiwaiSmith immigrant settler scholars like me get to learn from Indigenous feminist theorists instead of the same same old dead white men whose imaginations can't free us from colonialism.

name: Dr. Traci L. Morris, Ph.D.

name: Megan Red Shirt-Shaw
tweet: #BecauseOfLindaTuhiwaiSmith I have a reference I can point my non-Indigenous professors to and say - here. It‚Äôs written - and published - by an expert. This is what we‚Äôre talking about.

name: Andrew Flachs
tweet: #BecauseOfLindaTuhiwaiSmith I can teach an ethnography seminar where we center ethics and collaboration in the research design and read scholarship (including my own!) in a way that takes a critical, informed eye toward decolonizing our methodologies
